Topic.Title: Shorts, I have really bad news for you.

Message.Msg: and how does that help you?

How can you compare FB to AMZN? FB is a value play and growth story at the same time that has low expectations built in. Unlike AMZN, FB actually turns a profit while it invests and expands. It has true untapped potential it is sitting on - unlike AMZN which has any sliver of hope for profit blown out of proportion to support the ponzi scheme. FB has actual profits. Let's compare a few facts: 2013: FB is growing at 35%, AMZN 20% 2013 FCT: FB operating margin is 30%, AMZN 1% 2013 Operating Profit: FB = $2.0B, AMZN = $0.7B (while AMZN revs are 10x bigger!!!) Who should get the higher P/E??? Here is what the market thinks the answer to that question is: FB 2014 fwd P/E = 34 AMZN 2014 fwd P/E = 83 With a growth rate higher than its fwd P/E coupled with expanding margins not sure why you would short FB. AMZN on the other hand, has a P/E 4x is revenue growth, on shrinking revenue and an operating margin so low, that if the economy sneezes it will bleed cash.

Once: It's hopeless to educate those who are true believers. Never mind that Facebook truly does have network effects where Amazon's core business does not. FB and Google invest strategically in high ROIC assets. Amazon is rewarded for doing the opposite... This trading scam will be exposed in time... can't fight the diminishing true FCF and simultaneously increasing leverage into a weakening consumer for much longer. If not for the $3B in Q4 (on the back of less than forthright disclosures), Amazon would already be in trouble.
